decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing Flamewar, Brash Veteran as the commander. It includes a mix of powerful creatures, removal spells, and disruptive cards to apply pressure on the opponent and control the board. The deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. It also includes a variety of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Pyrokinesis to deal direct damage to the opponent and their creatures. Overall, the deck's key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast threats and efficient removal, making it difficult for them to stabilize and turn the game in your favor.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing Azusa's ability to play multiple lands per turn to ramp up quickly and establish a strong mana base. The deck includes cards that provide card advantage, such as Courser of Kruphix and Sylvan Library, as well as utility lands like Maze of Ith and Glacial Chasm to protect the commander and stall the game. With access to powerful spells like Crucible of Worlds and Emrakul, the Promised End, the deck can overwhelm opponents with powerful threats while disrupting their game plan. By efficiently ramping and controlling the board, this deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory in the long game.

The main idea behind this deck is to heavily control the game by utilizing a combination of powerful control spells, efficient removal, and disruptive creatures to keep the opponent on the back foot. Glarb, Calamity's Augur serves as the commander, offering a strong control element with its abilities. The deck focuses on countering threats, disrupting opponents' strategies, and ultimately out-valuing them in the long game. Cards like Force of Will, Counterspell, and Cryptic Command provide powerful counterspells, while cards like Fatal Push, Abrupt Decay, and Drown in the Loch offer efficient removal options. The deck also includes powerful card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. With this arsenal of control tools, the deck aims to dominate the game and grind out a victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd's ability to create tokens and pump them up with various equipment and enchantments to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck includes a mix of aggressive creatures like Elite Spellbinder and Skyclave Apparition, along with disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Drannith Magistrate to control the board. It also has interaction in the form of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain a strong board presence while disrupting their game plan, ultimately leading to a swift victory in a one-on-one duel.

The deck revolves around utilizing a wide variety of mana dorks, tutors, and protection spells to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By efficiently ramping and tutoring for key pieces, the deck aims to consistently put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. With access to powerful creatures like Ezio Auditore da Firenze and synergistic cards like Chord of Calling and Survival of the Fittest, the deck can adapt to different situations and maintain a strong presence on the battlefield. Overall, the key strategy is to consistently apply pressure, disrupt the opponent's plans, and quickly close out the game with a strong board state.
